strategy: Replace the random forest ensemble with a gradient boosting machine (e.g., XGBoost or LightGBM) and apply a novel feature engineering step: create polynomial features of degree 3 for the top 3 most correlated numerical variables (e.g., living area, garage area, total rooms), while also introducing quantile-based transformations (e.g., box-cox or Yeo-Johnson) on skewed variables to improve normality. Use time-based cross-validation with a 60-40 split to preserve temporal dynamics, and incorporate a small amount of noise injection (Gaussian noise with std=0.1) during training to enhance generalization. Evaluate on out-of-time test sets with a focus on stability across time periods.

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import TimeSeriesSplit
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, PowerTransformer
from sklearn.ensemble import GradientBoostingRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Log transform target variable to reduce skew
train_df['SalePrice'] = np.log1p(train_df['SalePrice'])

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_test = test_df.drop(['Id'], axis=1)
X_val = validation_df.drop(['Id'], axis=1)
y_val = validation_df['SalePrice']

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Handle missing values in categorical features
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna('Missing')
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna('Missing')
    X_val[col] = X_val[col].fillna('Missing')

# One-hot encode all categorical features
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)
X_val = pd.get_dummies(X_val, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)

# Align columns
common_columns = X_train.columns.intersection(X_test.columns).intersection(X_val.columns)
X_train = X_train[common_columns]
X_test = X_test[common_columns]
X_val = X_val[common_columns]
